prompts.hook: Your bank is betting you won't read this.
prompts.body: They're counting on you to auto-renew without comparing. That's how they keep charging you more than you should pay. 16,000+ Canadians stopped playing that game.
prompts.cta: See what they're not showing you
prompts.insight: Banks count on your overwhelm. The more confused you are, the less likely you are to shop around. Your paralysis is their profit.
prompts.prompt:
Create a 1:1 social media ad.

HEADLINE TEXT:
"Your bank is betting you won't read this." — render in bold white sans-serif, centered both vertically and horizontally, large enough to fill 70% of width. Text should feel confrontational, confident.

CTA TEXT:
"See what they're not showing you" — render in warm coral (#E8846B), bottom-center, medium weight, smaller than headline.

VISUAL ELEMENTS:
Minimal. Deep teal (#00707F) solid background. No illustrations or objects.

COMPOSITION:
Text-dominant. Headline is the only hero. CTA anchored at bottom with breathing room. 50% negative space around text elements.

STYLE:
Soft brutalism aesthetic. 10px warm coral border framing the entire composition. Clean, bold, no distractions.

DO NOT: Add any illustrations, icons, photos, or clay objects. The text IS the scroll-stop.

prompts.hook: Your business pays your bills. Why can't it buy you a home?
prompts.body: Banks rejected you because your income doesn't fit their checkbox. We've helped thousands of self-employed Canadians get approved—with rates that prove you weren't the risky one.
prompts.insight: Self-employed rejection isn't about risk—it's about paperwork convenience. Banks reject real businesses because approving them takes actual work.

prompts.hook: Our brokers don't make more when you pay more.
prompts.body: Salaried advisors. No commission. The advice you get is the advice you need—not the product that pays us best. That's why 16,000+ reviews say we're different.
prompts.cta: Talk to someone with nothing to sell you
prompts.insight: In an industry built on commission, salaried advisors are almost radical. Nobody talks about the conflict of interest baked into every recommendation.
prompts.prompt:

HEADLINE TEXT:
"Our brokers don't make more when you pay more." — render in bold white sans-serif, centered, large and commanding. This is the entire message.

CTA TEXT:
"Talk to someone with nothing to sell you" — render in seafoam (#E2F2F3), bottom-center, medium weight.

VISUAL ELEMENTS:
Minimal. Teal (#00707F) background with very subtle diagonal texture or grain for depth. No objects.

COMPOSITION:
Pure text layout. Headline centered vertically. CTA at bottom. Maximum impact through simplicity. 55% negative space.

STYLE:
Soft brutalism. 12px warm orange border for energy and contrast against teal. Bold, honest, refreshing.

DO NOT: Add icons of money, people, or any illustrations. The honesty of the statement needs no decoration.

prompts.hook: Find a lower rate. Anywhere. We'll pay you $500.
prompts.body: Not 'we'll try to match it.' Not 'terms and conditions apply.' Find a better rate or we hand you $500. $33 billion arranged means we don't make promises we can't back up.
prompts.insight: The guarantee isn't about confidence—it's about calling the bluff of an entire industry. Most 'best rates' are marketing. This one comes with a receipt.

HEADLINE TEXT:
"Find a lower rate. Anywhere. We'll pay you $500." — render in bold charcoal (#2D2D2D) sans-serif, top-center, large and confident. Three short punchy sentences.

CTA TEXT:
"Test us" — render in bold teal (#00707F), bottom-right, punchy and daring.

VISUAL ELEMENTS:
Large "$500" rendered in 3D terracotta clay, finger-pressed texture, positioned center. The number is the visual proof of the claim.

COMPOSITION:
Headline at top. Giant clay "$500" as centerpiece. CTA bottom-right. Cream (#F5F0E8) background. 40% negative space.

STYLE:
Soft brutalism. 10px teal border. Clay "$500" has depth, soft shadows, matte finish. Feels tangible and real—like money you could actually get.

DO NOT: Add other objects. The $500 is the only visual element needed.

prompts.hook: First home? You're allowed to not know what you're doing.
prompts.body: Everyone acts like this is simple. It's not. Free, no-pressure advice from experts who've guided 16,000+ Canadians through their first purchase. No stupid questions. Just answers.
prompts.insight: First-time buyers don't just want approval—they want permission to believe they can actually do this. The fear isn't the mortgage. It's making a catastrophic mistake you can't undo.

HEADLINE TEXT:
"First home? You're allowed to not know what you're doing." — render in bold white sans-serif, top third, left-aligned. Warm, reassuring, not intimidating.

CTA TEXT:
"Ask anything. Seriously." — render in sage green (#87A087), bottom-left, friendly weight.

VISUAL ELEMENTS:
Simple clay doorway or archway in terracotta, slightly ajar with warm amber glow coming through. Represents possibility without pressure. Minimal, not elaborate.

COMPOSITION:
Headline in top third. Clay doorway in lower half, off-center right. CTA bottom-left. Soft cream (#F5F0E8) background. Scene is gentle, not dominant.

STYLE:
Soft brutalism with softer touch. 8px terracotta border. Clay has rounded edges, feels approachable. The glow is warm, inviting—not overwhelming.

DO NOT: Make the scene complex or detailed. Keep it symbolic and simple. Text is still primary.

prompts.hook: That renewal letter? It's not a deadline. It's your leverage.
prompts.body: Your bank sent you a rate. They're hoping you'll just sign it. But right now, you have options they don't want you to explore. 120 days is plenty of time to find out what you're actually worth.
prompts.insight: The renewal letter feels like a deadline, not an opportunity. Banks frame it as 'your time is running out' when really it's 'your leverage just arrived.'
